review: I took the mother of my child and my daughter to this location and it was a great decision. At first I was reluctant to go in because of past experiences I've had at other locations but I was wrong to judge this one without giving it a chance. Suhhel was our server and she was great from start to finish. She also anticipated our needs and we really appreciated her service. Then there was Peri the hostess that was sweet as can be. We talked to Peri for a while and she was very pleasant. We will definitely stop by again in the near future when in the area. Thank you.

Taste: mixed bag, drinks and app good, pizza lacking, I do not think they know what tomato sauce is; Service: mixed bag again, nice waitress with food on her chin, rushing servers with thumbs in the food, glasses dropping several times, this rushing about business does not help them provide good service; Decor: very plain, tight, cramped, outdoor is on the parking lot; Price for quality: over priced by a bit, coupons available; Beers: none worth having.

Sometimes good, sometimes not. I like it mostly b/c I like their salads. Though I never did understand why they removed their mediterranean chicken salad -it was to die for! Now I do ok with their Chinese chicken salad though I don't love it. We were there yesterday while the manager was firing an employee - not exactly totally professional to do it in front of customers... It's easily accessible in the mall (Boca Town Center) and it is moderately priced. It's good for all ages which is even better! You can also sit outside which in the nice weather is a bonus. (It's located near Nordstrom's).

I personally really enjoy coming to CPK. The food and service is always good when I come.  They start you off with realllllly good bread and an oil. I'm pretty sure the bread is hot too. I always sit outside because it's less crowded and also better for bigger parties, especially if your party is loud. They do have fans but it's Florida so it does get hot depending on when you go.  The kids menu is pretty good, and the kids Mac & Cheese is amazing. I also always get the Waldorf Chicken Salad with iceberg lettuce, (It doesn't say cheese on the menu but it does come with cheese if you're not a cheese person), and it's very good!! The "half" portions are bigger than you would expect. I get half, and I'm full after.  I've never had problems with the service, all the staff that I have met are friendly. If you come to CPK often then I suggest you become a member so you can get points which will lead to discounts or free pizzas!

The worst service. Food took forever to arrive and we only ordered pasta and a salad. The table next to ours was full of dirty dishes for about half hour (see pic.) I had to ask someone twice to clear it.

Terrible service! we waited forever for the food , once they brought it the waitress only brought part of it,  and then we had to wait forever again for the part of the order , 1/2 of our table ate and finished first and had to wait 1 hr more for the rest of the order

Service is pretty hit or miss but the Thai Chicken Pizza is bomb! Always get it with extra sauce on the side to dip the crust in. Right combo of sweet and spicy. Low key (not so low key) wish they'd bring back the buffalo chicken pizza.

Woah ok, so my friends love this place and I was never that big of a fan. BUT once I started ordering things other than the pizza, I started to understand. (Which is ironic)  What I've been ordering is the Thai Crunch salad. It's seriously amazing. It's not like your ordinary salad, you have to try it.  With the salad, depending on how hungry I am because it is pretty filling if you get the full size, I get the Farmers Market soup. Which is this amazing squash soup that has plenty of flavor and really hits the spot.  I hear the tea's are really good! So, you can give that a try! Other than that, I haven't really tried much on the menu. But if you're shopping and need a quick but delicious bite, this place will do it! Not too expensive and plenty of choices on the menu!  Enjoy!

In my opinion, CPK always hits the spot. Their menu has options that satisfy any mood you're in. Whenever my friends and I can't pick a place to eat, we end up here. The thai crunch salad is my favorite thing on the menu. It's actually my favorite salad ever. The salad is fresh and has a little bit of a kick in the dressing. I once bought a bottle of the dressing to go... My other fave is their mac and cheese with edamame. You wouldn't think to add edamame to it, but I promise it's fire. Sometimes I get a half salad and a kid's mac, when I crave both of these. I have never had a complaint with this location. The service is great and the food is delicious. Definitely one of my favorite places for a casual lunch or dinner. :)

We arrived at 9pm on a Wednesday night.  They close at 9:30.  The hostess seemed very reluctant to seat us and told us the kitchen would not be happy with us arriving so late.   There were many other customers in the restaurant.  We sat down and the server even had an attitude.  We ordered drinks but decided after that to leave.  It is unfortunate that the claim certain hours but really don't expect to serve during the entire open hours.  We will not likely return.
Cpk stepped it up. Servers manager and hostesses on par,  way more than in the past. Thank you for attention to detail and orior ratings from us

Love love love CPK. Their broccolini is my favorite thing!!! I come here a lot because the menu has a lot of different things on it that I enjoy. I don't get the same thing every time but I do get that broccolini always. Their grilled chicken is good. I also like their mac n cheese and pizzas. I'm not a salad person, but my girlfriends love the Thai crunch. My kids also love the pizza here so it's a win. The service is pretty good. All of the servers are nice and most of the time the food comes quickly. The cocktails are great but pricey. And I've never tried the desserts. Other things to point out... Awesome patio area. I like to dine outside when I come here. Fun kids menus. Love how it's in the mall so I can walk off my meal with some shopping. :)

My boyfriend and I came here after shopping an hour before closing. The staff was very nice and the place was clean and welcoming. We sat outside which was nice. Our server came out with fresh bread and olive oil. He made some great suggestions on what's good on the menu. My boyfriend went with the chicken Milanese and I had the chicken piccata. Both plates were delicious! They also recommend wine that pairs well with each dish and we ordered that as well. They were both chilled white wine. Delicious. I wish I could remember the name of them. They paired really well with our dishes. The chicken was cooked perfectly and the presentation was super cute! We enjoyed our dinner here and enjoyed the food and drinks. Our server was attentive and kind. We will definitely be coming back to this location.
Server was nice but the food was not good. The guac and chips was chincy and the Caesar salad was assembly line garbage.  Will never be back.

Pleasant server.  So-so Cobb Salad.  A decent choice if you are already in the mall but definitely not as a destination even for a casual lunch.  I ordered blue cheese dressing for my salad and although the dressing had chunks of blue cheese in it, it tasted like ranch dressing.   I should note that the front of the house staff was very helpful and accommodating too.

Always a pleasure to come here great atmosphere, so laid back yet so much to see. The staff is very kind, can get slow due to the high volume of people at night, so come during the day or early evening for quicker service. The food is delicious. I highly recommend the tostada pizza and the bbq pizza. The drinks are well made, decent prices.

We were here for a family birthday.  After being seated promptly, the waiter came to take our drink order.  He then brought the drinks and left a few straws on the table, but not enough for all of our drinks.  We finally got his attention and he came over and stated that he had 'counted the number of straws he needed'.  Huh??  You don't have extras in your apron?  What waiter does not carry straws - or even worse counts them??!!  He brought some extras over after that.   Next we ordered appetizers. I had the Sahara desert - oops, I mean the Italian chopped.  It was drier than the Sahara desert!  I could have picked some greens and thrown them on my plate and it would have tasted the same.  The general consensus of everyone was that the appetizers were just okay.   For my main course, I ordered the Margarita pizza.  Although it clearly states on the menu (as does every single restaurant I have ordered this from) that it comes with Italian tomatoes, there was not a single tomato on the pizza.  I asked the waiter where the tomatoes were and he said they're in the sauce!  For real??  Noooo!  A Margarita pizza means there are tomatoes ON TOP. The others in our party who ordered pizza all said the same thing; they were just okay, nothing special and on top of that they tasted as if they were premade and reheated.  Hard crusts on the top and they looked very dried up.   This was my third and final time dining in CPK.  There is nothing redeeming about it.  The service was so-so, food was subpar and overall not worth returning for.

CPK is always a crowd pleaser, and never disappoints. However, their food is nothing to write home about. My friends and I go here often because of its universal appeal--literally anyone can eat here and be happy with the menu. I love the Waldorf Salad and jalapeño fettuccini Alfredo. The thai crunch salad is also amazing (the best version of that type of salad in my opinion), and the soup is surprisingly tasty. They also do side by side soups and if you're an indecisive nerd like me then you will find that pretty cool.  Contrary to their name, I don't think their pizzas are anything too special. I'll order the pizza occasionally because I like the personal sized portion, but I've definitely had better pizza. I don't think they get enough credit for their drinks. I've had great sangria , margaritas, and Moscow mules there as well.
Food is average, but it is franchise fare. Service is very slow and inattentive. If you want better reviews, act like you care about your customers. Nice people - just painfully slow.

I've been in some other CPK but this one wasn't good.  My steak pizza came incomplete some of the slices didn't have any meat.  They made a mistake with my daughter's order and gave her a pizza with no pepperoni then they "fixed" the order so instead of making a new pizza they simply put pepperoni on top, so all the pepperoni were stuck together and were not cut with the slices. We couldn't find our waitress because she was taking care of people not only inside but also outside the restaurant.  I hope the fix those problems but it seems that management can fix that.  I don't know if I am going back again there.

Stopped in for a celebratory group lunch with some colleagues. My friend and I arrived a bit later than the rest of the party and was happy to see that the waitress could accomodate our beverage orders quickly.  Pressed for time I skipped the appetizers and went straight for the carnitas pizza on a thin crust.  When the food for the rest of the table was brought out, I realized my pizza was prepared on a regular crust. Having noticed the error, our waitress offered to remake the pizza. As we were waiting (no more than 5 mins later) the manager brings over the white corn appetizer as a courtesy.  It was delicious! Nice chunks of avocado mixed into white corn and jicama.  My pizza arrived within minutes and was absolutely delicious. The flavors were better than expected and was very filling.  When our check was brought out, the manager had comped both the appetizer and the pizza for the delay in delivery and mix-up.  Above and beyond service and delicious food is definitely going to make another trip to CPK a must!

Fantastic place to grab a bite to eat. I had the chicken and vegetables and I'll tell ya it looked so good I couldn't take a picture of it before it was all gone. Our server was great and it was overall a great experience. Plus they allow dogs outside!!!! Will be back for sure.

I love that they have a California pizza kitchen at the Boca mall so you can stop in for a quick bite while shopping. My friend and I got BBQ chicken salad and the Chicken Club Pizza (that's my fav). We wanted to order the mac and cheese balls but they were out. Sharing those meals was more than enough, I had to get a togo box.

You can never really go wrong with California Pizza Kitchen.  I have been here a few times and I love their food. My favorite from past visits would be the Fire Roasted Chile Relleno. I absolutely love it. The chile relleno consist of spicy poblano that is stuffed with chicken, cheese, roasted corn, black bean salsa, wild mushrooms, spinach and eggplant. I have also had the Pesto Cream Penne and it was delicious as well.   Recently I came here for lunch. Service was very fast and our waitress was very friendly and attentive.  I decided to give the lunch duo a try. My pick was the 7" pepperoni pizza with the  sedona tortilla soup. Our orders were ready super quick. This duo definitely fills you up. I could not finish up the pizza and took half of it home. The Sedona tortilla soup is delicious and full of flavor.  Overall, it was delicious and service was super fast. I'll be back.

Soooo.... I was using the bathroom in this establishment and as I was washing my hands I notice a worker come out of the stall and just exit the rest room with out washing her hands.....as comfortable as she was walking out the restroom specially while there were other customers in there let's me know she does this often... I will not ever be eating here!!!!!

Dining experiences come down to one solid single thing in my opinion and that would be SERVICE. It wouldn't be likely that I would say CPK has the best pizza in all the land but it's great, the bread is great, the guacamole is good and they even have VEGETARIAN and even VEGAN  options which are a big plus for those of us that don't partake in eating meat or dairy. I've been to this location three times and each time I've gotten good service but one server stuck out in particular, she went by the name of CHELSEA and greeted my girlfriend  and I with a smile and prompt descriptions of the food choices, specials, personal favorites and INGREDIENTS... I could get served a rock and a shoe and would be more understanding of that than getting bad service when I'm a paying customer. Great service is key to a successful restaurant, you can check my other reviews if you think that's anything short of my bar of tankards. I highly recommend this place and if you go, I hope you get CHELSEA.

Came here on my break and chose to sit at the bar. The red headed bearded bartender saw me sit and didn't speak a word for the first few minutes "I'll be with you" without even the slightest smile. As if I was doing a disservice by sitting at his bar. I ordered the garlic chicken pizza, delish. Not like he would know that though because felt no need to check with me to see how it was. I finished my water and he held out his hand signally that he wanted to refill it. I laughed in disbelief. Won't be sitting at the bar again.
Their food is mediocre, nothing to brag about. Their white wine sangria on the other hand..... stupid good.

Went to California pizza kitchen for the third time and had an awful initial experience. I was with my girlfriend so there was only two of us to seat. The hostess initially said 5-10 min. We sat there for the next 20 mins watching three tables that came after us get seated before us. I do not know what happened but we felt like they seated the larger tables first so they could make more money. We almost took our service elsewhere but I know how good the food is so we stayed. But I will think twice before I go back to the one in the boca mall again.

Curbside carry out is fast & accurate every time.  The food quality, taste & appearance are on the mark every time we order from here.  Great place for kids...affordable & tasteful.  My son loves the Mac & cheese.  And their salted caramel, red velvet cake and butter cake are a MUST!!

For a great and unique pizza I come here! Wait staff is always friendly, and the food is always good. The best of course is dessert. Make sure you save room for the butter cake! OMG!!!!! Like you have died and gone to heaven! SO GOOD! We are a regular here and for good reason. Even though it is in the mall it is still an amazing casual dining experience.

Never been to one, as wasn't sure of the concept. California pizza? Do I make my own? And not real big on chains either. But I was always curious, and having been Xmas shopping all afternoon, and not really desiring mall court food, we went with the convenience of having the CPK right at the end of the mall we finished at. Fate brought me to try this place. I really liked the interior, the lights were not bright nor was it dark and we were seated right away. They have flat screens and a view of the kitchen.  So first glance of the menu and I see you don't stick the pizza in yourself. Hmm ok, lets try the Moroccan spiced chicken and white-corn guac and chips. I should have realized right away the "California" means "Avocado-in-everything". We ordered the "California Club" pizza. Hey we're at CPK, may as well live out the experience the whole way through! And sure enough, our pizza looked like a salad complete with avocados on top. I'm not complaining, I grew up with them and love them. But my wife doesn't at all, and my kid... forget about it. So I wound up eating mostly all of them, but next time will be holding back on ordering the guac. I was going to give a 3-and-a-half-star, but little things bumped it up. The peach iced tea was great, the bread came with a dipping sauce and was attentive and we just enjoyed the evening after being tired of walking round the mall, so it bumped it up to a 4-star. Would I come again? Sure, but be mindful of all the items with avocado, i'm surprised they haven't come up with a avocado desert! hmmmmm

Just had a great dining experience with Omar as the waiter yummy food quick service with a smile. My wife and I shared a Waldorf salad which was excellent. I had a gluten free pepperoni pizza and my wife had a gluten free wild mushroom pizza both were delicious. To drink (this is always my favorite part of this place) I had a captain Morgan's and vanilla rootbeer and my wife had a captains and diet dr. Pepper. They have the new coke machine with like 100 different flavors which is awesome :)

I eat here regularly and also sometimes order lunch for delivery. Delivery is really where it shines...the chicken side was still warm for today's lunch order.  Best salad is the Waldorf chicken.  Thanks cali chicken !!

** GReAT STuFF ** Amazing $15 three course meal.  I ordered the Kids size freshly cooked BBQ pizza with summer-perfect arugula side salad with asparagus, tossed in house made lemon vinaigrette with sun-dried tomatoes - YUM Ending my hunger with the amazing summer berries & vanilla bean sabayon dessert.  Wow that hit the spot!

We got to CPK regularly because we live close by and they have decent food. We usually eat at the restaurant  Tonight we ordered a to-go order, for the first time, for a family of 4. Two pizzas- Spinach and Artichoke and BBQ Chicken Pizza, and two cups of Tortilla Soup. And a side Caesar salad. We ordered online and we're told to pick up at 7:10.  When we got there we had to wait for our order because they said the pizza is still in the oven. They brought us our food and good thang we looked because our soup wasn't in there.  We live less than 2 miles from CPK. By the time we got home our pizza was cold. I could understand it being warm but it was literally cold.  The soups were almost laughable. They were hot but were filled up MAYBE a 1/4 of the container. If that's their cup size, that is a very expensive cup at $4.25.  I would advise for a to-go/online order you make sure to really check your order before leaving the restaurant. We ended up having to heat up the pizza when we got home.  We did call to let the manager know and their customer service definitely is superior to other places. We will be back because of their excellent customer service.

The food is great, the service is friendly and the atmosphere is nice, especially their outside patio. The manager is awesome and soooooo very attentive and accommodating!  He made our meal so enjoyable and I can tell he's a VERY hard-worker!  Such a nice man! :-)

I had to write this review for all the CPK take-out lovers like my self. One star is overrated for the repeated experiences my family has been having with this company. We fell in love with CPK while in Culver City CA and had great experiences as we did later at the Palm Beach Garden FL location: great staff, great food, great service. When we moved to Boca Raton it all went downhill. Pretty much every take-out we get is missing items or we receive smaller portions then we ordered. We had contacted the location from the very first time it happened and the resolution we were offered was for us to drive right back and pick up the missing item (about a 30 min drive for us...while CPK does offer delivery for some extra cash it seams an error on their part is not worth management those extra bucks to get it delivered....not even when repeatedly commiting the same mistake over and over and over again drawing shoulders and blaming it on management). For those unfamiliar with the reasoning: not providing a service or product that has been payed for is simple: theft! Last attempt was at the Wellington FL location where we were given again an item short and a salad filled with rotten black avocados...the math of which skips me: gourmet prices for low end fast-food services and products.  But it does not end here: my husband finally got trough to management (national) and presented his complaint. with heartfelt apologies for the money and trouble we were offered a gift card that was supposed to arrive sometime...since november?! last year! the next deplorable experience we had we tried to contact them again and were once again offered heartfelt apologies for both the crappy service and for not receiving our compensation and were told we were going to receive our gift card. It is march now...still nothing. Fact is, I would not eat from KPC if they had Buddha him self on the staff. It is not a decision we took on an impulse but after multiple sessions of "rape" and disrespect for a regular paying customer. It almost feels like they are being cheap asses trying to save a buck on our behalf...which should never be the philosophy of a company with their pricing. I actually took the energy to contact consumer protection services and, believe it or not, i hate complaining as  i hate spending time on the web writing long reviews like this one. I do no longer even trust the quality or sanitary conditions they have as such loose treatment of customer orders and complaints denote negligence and carelessness and, well, you know "the way we do anything is the way we do everything" hope this is helpful

The food is always good here. They are consistent and I always get either the BBQ chicken pizza or the salad. I've also had the garlic and cheese pizza. The last time I had it though I thought it didn't have as much garlic taste as I remembered so I was a little disappointed. The flavored teas are tasty and appetizer wise the spinach artichoke dip and the dumplings are definite winners. The fried Mac and cheese from the starter menu however is a bust. I've ordered it twice and both times it was the same feeling of, those were some wasted calories that I won't get back. :(  Overall I would recommend CPK for either lunch or dinner. Try to avoid peak times because the wait will be long.
It's a nice family centered restaurant.   Service is quick and pleasant.   Food is pretty good

This place is awesome!  I work in the mall so i go here all the time.  i love the pizza and the sandwiches, their menu is pretty extensive and they have a wide selection..especially of pizzas..i like the California club pizza, very good..the price is a little up there, but that's expected. this place is always crowded, a favorite for a lot of people.  One pizza will be enough for any appetite. They have a good team with a mix of youth and age, service is good, the food comes out pretty quick
Great kids menu and good soups.  Servers are usually very attentive and salads are fresh.

Worst service ever!!! After a long wait for a table, which we expected, we were seated on the patio.  We sat and waited --- more than 20 minutes passed and we were never approached by ANYONE!  We watched other tables ( seated well after us) have their order taken and receive their orders while we sat there.  Our table was right in the center of the patio, so plenty of waitstaff, busboys, and even a manager type passed by,all were too busy to even make eye contact,so we gave up and left.  Sad because we do like the food, but will not go back!

at dinner here as we speak. We were not done eating apps yet and our main course arrived I feel like we being rushed. I feel like they need a lesson on how to run a kitchen and on timing. One more thing If you have an open kitchen clean your floors up I hate that I'm sitting at the bar and the floor is dirty the funny thing is the manager is in the kitchen and has not done anything about SWEEP YOUR FLOOR....

Definitely love this place.  This has been my go-to lunch stop when shopping at the Boca Mall a couple of times now. I love they're 5 cheese and tomato pizza - big enough for 2 or 3, depending on how hungry you are.  They're flavored lemonades and a favorite in my family, and their Spinach artichoke dip too.  But now we discovered their artichoke appetizers and those are delicious.  Not big, so it won't spoil your appetite but enough to calm the hunger until your entrée arrives. Last time I went I tried the Cheese Ravioli with sautéed mushrooms - you have to try it!!!  Amazing, with a glass of red sangria and my shopping day was perfect.

As good as you'll get for a chain. They change up the menu with enough regularity, and they've been looking at both tastes and dietary trends. I tried a new salad with quinoa and greens and it was I want to steal the recipe goodness.  If you're at the mall, it's one of the best places to grab a bite.

My go to place when I need a quick bite to eat (just don't go on the weekends.... wait is 25-30 minutes).  Its located smack dab in the middle of the mall... so its pretty convenient if you are shopping.  Its not the best pizza in the world.... but its pretty darn good pizza.  But if pizza is not your desire, they have an array of other things.  One of my favorite dishes is actually a salad.  The Thai Crunch salad with avocado.... it is an additional charge for the avocado, but worth it.  DO IT!  Comes with chicken, cabbage, cucumber, carrots, peanuts, soybeans, and a spicy thai dressing.... SOOOO GOOD!!!   But, if you are craving some pizza... well, you will have a long list to choose from.  Unfortunately they lost a star because they took my favorite pizza off the menu:  The Greek!  GONE... bye bye... never to be heard from again.  But, they still have one of the best, the pear and Gorgonzola pizza.  Get it on honey whole wheat, totally worth it.  Slices of pear on the pizza, with hazelnuts and topped with a salad of arugula and Parmesan.  Very very good.  The Thai and the carnitas is really good too.       I've never had anything else there besides soup, salad, pizza and dessert.  The peach tea is pretty decent too!  Overall, its a decent place to grab some food.

This is one of the smaller restaurants in the chain.  The food was good quality as expected but the service was mediocre.  However, the manager was very friendly and interacted with the guests.  He pitched in and helped where he could.

I actually never get the pizza. I always get the garlic cream fettucini with chicken. It's probably the best fettucini I've ever had.  This location has a covered outdoor area that I like. Being outside is always a nice option. Price: B Food: A Service: Usually B or C Atmosphere: B+
Very good pizza restaurant with moderate indoor and large outdoor seating. I am glad to see them back in Boca Raton.

I'm glad CPK is back in Boca.  I learned about it on Yelp, and set out to find it last night while up in that area.  It took us a while, since the GPS does not help at all when it comes to an address in the mall, and I never go to the expensive side (Saks/Nordstrom's) - for the record, it's located between the two stores, next to Legal Sea Foods. I'm a traditionalist when it comes to pizza, and just want it with cheese and sauce.  I would've gotten the regular one on the honey wheat crust, but I decided to try the neapolitan pizza, which is a thin crust pizza and came with a pomodoro sauce with smoked gouda, fontina, and mozzarella.  You could definitely taste the gouda, which gave it a different flavor.  It was really good, but quite big (I only managed to eat half of it).  The boyfriend got the hawaiian and had all except one slice of his. We came around 8:30 on a Wednesday night, so seating was hardly an issue.  Our waiter was attentive, and service was quick, so overall it was a good experience :)

We hadn't been to this location in quite a while. Wow, what changes! New menu with beautiful pictures and a totally new look in the restaurant. We saw a lot of new faces. Looked like new management. When we said it had been a while since our last visit the hostess named Emily took time to tell us about the new menu. Chris, the manager, came over to greet us shortly after Emily left the table. He wanted to welcome us back and thank us for coming in. He mentioned that CPK was reinventing their menu selection and their look and that Boca was one of the first to do so. He recommended the halibut and the ribeye steak since they were new items. Our server was Jaquez, who was such a polite server. We loved the halibut, the butter cake, the service, the ambiance and the welcoming staff who made sure we loved our experience. This is how CPK just became our favorite restaurant.
Pizza two days in a row. Switch the pizzas up but the chicken dumpling app always should remain constant. Sometimes comes out a little cold, but really cant go wrong.

CPK is back in Boca! They didn't make it a few years back at their location near Houstons, but looks like the new CPK (located within the Town Center Mall) is off to a good start.  They were packed on this Tuesday evening, but my mom and I scored a tableon their heated outdoor patio. Gotta love being able to sit on a patio (even if it's a heated one) in March. Yep, Chicago people reading my review...you're jealous, aren't ya? ;) I have to admit I've always been a fan of CPK's pizzas, but tonight we went with the salads. We started with a pita and hummus appetizer.  The pita was warm and soft; the hummus was just eh.  Then my mom had a half order of the chopped salad (she said it was just ok) and i had a the delicious new miso salad.  I switched out the miso dressing for lime cilantro (allergic to soy...sigh) and it was delicious! Wouldn't run to dine at CPK, but if you're in the mall and hungry it's a good place to stop...
Great salads. Pizza is just ok. Not a bargain, but food is solid. $30 for a regular pizza and entree salad.  Service is good. Wasn't too busy due to bad rain.

I like this place when hitting the mall. Pizzas are fresh with interesting toppings, and the salads are great. I like the Cobb or the BBQ chicken salad.  It's a nice place for a good sit down but quick meal. Beats Panera for a couple dollars more wih service.

Uk!  New management has taken this once great place to the dumps.  We walked in, tables only half-full, and were told it was a 10 minute wait? ?!!  That was the writing on the way....also floors filthy and the place just seemed chaotic. Tried to get the manager,  but he was too occupied with disgruntled diner to do anything....no thanks.  Walked out, won't be back.  Too many good choices in this town for such nonsense.

Another chain! But I found a new addiction- like crack head addiction! The chocolate chip cookie dessert is seriously like crack (I would think) Like it tasted like raw cookie dough but cooked simply amazing! O and the BBQ chicken salad is pretty good too!!

This isn't your average pizza place and seems to be known to people that have lived out of Florida. It was my first time being there and it was decent, to say the least. There is a very wide selection of pizzas, pastas and salads.  Pizzas are a bit tiny (perhaps a small to regular pizza joints) but had toppings I didn't even know existed and nevertheless yummy.  The Tequila pasta...oh, mouth watering good. Seating service was a bit slow - but I guess that's always going to be the case when arriving during the lunch hour traffic. Food service on the other hand was pretty quick in retrospect.  FYI, wear something comfortable (I ate a little too much and had to unbuckle my jacket a bit).
Love this place. They have the best soups and their small bites menu is perfect w/a soup. Also they have fab salads. I've heard the pizza was great too but that's the last thing I order when there!

Every time I go to CPK I promise I won't go back, then stupidly I end up there.  The service is always terrible, the food either comes out wrong or cold.  While I used to love it, I think it's a huge rip off and the service is bad.

They have a great selection of pizza and other items so you should find something you like.The prices are a bit high though and wow was it slow last night. We waited like 25 mins for a small personal size pizza. Food was tasty but I was so hungry at that point anything might have been good.  I would not put this place on my regular list

I give 2 stars because their hostesses are very inattentive.  I asked for a table for 2 and they never asked for my name and told me that a table was being cleaned and they would be with me shortly.  More people were coming in and they were being seated.  They totally forgot about me and my party and I had to remind them 2 times.  Very annoying.   Other than that, the food was ok.  I was really hungry.

Really enjoyed lunch!  I had a nice green salad to start. Portion was perfect and dressing delicious!  Then I shared the veggie pizza with my daughter and my son-in-law had pizza with some type of chicken. We also shared the fish tacos which were delicious!  Service was quick and friendly. I would definitely re-visit.

Love their baroque chicken pizza. Went with friends and the food was fresh and tasted so good....we celebrated my sister birthday and had so much fun. Service was quick and friendly. The waiter really made sure everyone was happy.
We love coming here. We order the Cobb salad with a plank of salmon and romaine lettuce. They are willing to accommodate substitutes and changes. The pound cake dessert is yummy but super dangerous.

CPK gets 5 stars because every time I come here I am happy with the food and service. They also have awesome Kids Menus. You can make reservations and call do ahead seating as well. It's located in Town Center Mall by Saks Fifth Avenue. CPK works well with big parties. I have tried many entrees on their Menu including the Kids Menu and love all of them. From their pizzas and pastas to their salads and appetizers everything has great flavor. They also give you bread with a seasoned olive oil dipping sauce. Sometimes they forget to bring it out, so you have to ask for it. My favorite dish on the Kids Menu is the Mac and Cheese with edamame. You can choose whether you want the edamame or not (it's a small extra charge). The dish is pretty big and sometimes I can't even finish it. My favorite salad is the Asian Thai Crunch with Chicken. It has crunchy rice noodles, peanuts, and the dressing has a little kick to it, but nothing crazy. My favorite pasta is the Mushroom pasta. It is filled with flavor and if you love mushrooms, try this out. I've tried most of the pizzas and all of them were delicious. I love the thin crust. CPKs portions are pretty big. It  may look small in the dish, but it is more than enough! Sometimes when I come here with my family, we'll order a pizza and 2 or 3 entrees to share.  The service here is awesome. Every waiter I've had always came to the table several times throughout my meal to refill water or to ask if we needed anything. The wait is never long either and it's great that it is in the mall because you can go walk around and shop, which makes time go by faster! CPK is a relaxed environment, no need to dress up, but you can if you want. Overall, my family, friends and I are always happy customers at this particular CPK restaurant!

Boca location has the best service! Always fresh food and a great assortment on the menu.  I'm a vegetarian and have no problem finding choices there. The managers of the restaurant are always present and pitching in to help the staff.  It really seems like family and everyone enjoying their jobs!  Must have the chocolate soufflé or the butter cake!!!

Got lucky and caught the lunch duo special on a Tuesday afternoon. $10.95 is a steal for a 7" pizza and a salad. Nice size portion for salad, but I did have to ask for extra dressing. Pretty quick service for a late lunch.

Good friendly service from the bar.  Sometimes I feel the staff is too preoccupied with their side duties instead of serving patrons. They are always cleaning or fiddling with something else.   They are always pleasant though.  The Pizza is always fantastic. Their other food looks good as well but I tend to always get the BBQ chicken pizza.   They have good beer selection as well for a chain restaurant.
Food is nothing out of this world, overprice for what you get.  Also staff not friendly and inflexible.

It's not that I expect an amazing dining experience from a place like this, but when I do expect from a national chain is some semblance of order, decency, and know how. From being seated, to waiting on our server to acknowledge us, to placing our order (which of course, came out completely wrong and ill-timed), the entire experience was a clear reflection of a place putting college kids to work who 1) don't care 2) have never been formally trained by management. All of this being said, there didn't appear to be a manager who seemed to care about her job. I called her over, we had a very nice discussion, and she expressed her frustration as well. On my way out, I noticed another gentleman asking for the manager who was also visibly frustrated. The main point of this review is to tell restaurant ownership, management or corporate executives that this location is in a very high traffic area, and the staff that works there have literally no clue on what they're doing!

Mike Hanzas the manager made the experience very good . He greeted us when we walked in , and kept checking on us. Kinda rare for south Florida restaurants where service can be terrible. I appreciated that and mentioned I would specifically leave him a review because of that.  I gave it four stars not a five because the food there is always good, but I'm not blown away. I had a BLT pizza, I wasn't a big fan of it, but all the previous times I go when I get an entrée I do really enjoy it.

Don't sit at the "bar" here. The same guy always works behind there and he always seems as if he's miserable. He has only come up to me once willingly. To take my order. I had to flagged him down when they served me the opposite of what I ordered. He never came back to check to see if I was ok or the food was good. No drink refill. Nothing. I had to flag him down to get my check.

Recently rolled up to CPK on a Thursday with a party of 28 people. Yes, 28 people! The general manager, Michael, was more that accommodating when I called to check if it was possible. The tables were set up by the time we got there and all of the waiters/waitresses that served us were very friendly and quick. Drinks were constantly refilled and the pre-meal bread and olive oil was also replenished once or twice. My two favorites at CPK are the BBQ Chicken Pizza and the Jerk Chicken Flatbread. The Jerk Chicken has a nice kick as tastes great, but can be a bit dry. The BBQ Chicken is amazing, enough sauce and flavor to last the whole personal pie they give you. Overall, CPK has great service and great food. Can't beat that!

I had a salad with a fat free dressing. Nothing I ever want to order but was very pleasantly surprised. The dressing was the best fat free I ever had. The salad had great almonds ( small interesting ones ), butternut squash pieces that looked like croutons, great chicken etc. Very pleased.

So I don't normally frequent this place but I was forced to park my vehicle in their "carry out" spot. To be in compliance I went in and ordered a salad and a drink before heading off to do some shopping in the mall. Well, the bartender Shane is absolutely a kind, awesome, informative, knowledgeable, server/bartender. I'm vegetarian, the salad I ordered came with chicken, he immediately took the words out is my mouth and offered avocado as a substitute. No up charge like most restaurants. That's some good coaching and training right there. Next......I noticed what I thought to be a manager come in, he greeted ever staff member individually, walked around each of their work stations, made his way towards me, smiled at me and said hi. This is extreme great service  and rest assured my family and I, my sons and their friends, will be back. No more driving all the way to the Ave (Atlantic in Delray) for great food and service when I live on East Boca. I'm wow'd and impressed. Thank you guys! By the way, it was a manager, his name is Michael.
As yelp describes 5 stars. Woohoo! As good as it gets! Never been disapointed everytime I go there. Their new menu is very good.  I keep bringing colleagues there & they all love it.
lmmkmkmrtkmllmmlmhttpmms://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Mark very nice and clean good food open kitchen so you can see what's going on wild wat eting
If only they'd swap a plate of veggies for bread (we're Gluten Free) and start adding GF desserts. Soon maybe.

I had lunch today here and I had received a free birthday dessert on email through the cpk rewards. My cpk rewards card was not registered and the manager, Michael, was extremely helpful to help me get it registered. It's so nice to receive amazing service in South Florida, you don't find that too often here. Thank you for making my lunch memorable!

Well... The hostess was nice. Besides that this place is a joke when it comes to good service. Waited over 15 minutes to be greeted with " sorry your server is extremely busy are you ready to order? I can give it to her" lol okay... We ordered and it was another 40 mins to get our food ( 2 ppl ) food is pretty good though. We got two pizzas; mushroom and Thai chicken. We also ordered spinach and artichoke dip. Too bad the service is terrible, hopefully it was just a bad night or server! Will more than likely skip going back

Came on Sunday afternoon after some shopping in the mall. Service was slow and slower. Ordered a salad and pizza took over 40 minutes for pizza to come with no manager coming to apologize for the slow kitchen. When you have 18 employees walking around aimlessly with headsets and customers are sitting waiting for food we have a problem. Will be going to Italian place next door from now on.
